clusters.title: Munich airport resumes flights after drone sightings trigger closure
clusters.neutral_headline: Munich Airport Reopens After Drone Sightings Disrupt Flights

items.title: Munich airport resumes flights after drone sightings trigger closure
items.standfirst: Munich became the latest to close its airspace on Thursday night after several drone sightings, causing more than 30 flights to be cancelled or diverted
items.content: Munich became the latest to close its airspace on Thursday night after several drone sightings, causing more than 30 flights to be cancelled or diverted

items.title: Munich airport reopens after drone sightings force closure
items.standfirst: Dozens of flights were cancelled or redirected at Munich International Airport after drone sightings.
items.content: Dozens of flights were cancelled or redirected at Munich International Airport after drone sightings.

items.title: Munich airport closed after drone sightings
items.standfirst: Flights were diverted or cancelled in latest incident involving unidentified objects in European airspace
items.content: Flights were diverted or cancelled in latest incident involving unidentified objects in European airspace

items.title: Munich airport resumes flights after drone sightings; passengers stranded
items.standfirst: The sightings follow similar incidents in Denmark and Norway last week.
items.content: The sightings follow similar incidents in Denmark and Norway last week.

items.title: Munich drone sightings force airport to cancel flights in latest Europe disruption
items.standfirst: The German airport was forced to suspend operations, in the latest drone disruption to European aviationDrone sightings over Munich airport on Thursday evening forced air traffic control to suspend operations, leading to the cancellation of 17 flights and disrupting travel for nearly 3,000 passengers in the German city.Another 15 arriving flights were diverted to Stuttgart, Nuremberg, Vienna and Frankfurt, the airport said in a statement, marking the latest drone disruption to European aviation after sightings temporarily shut airports in Denmark and Norway last week. Continue reading...
items.content: The German airport was forced to suspend operations, in the latest drone disruption to European aviationDrone sightings over Munich airport on Thursday evening forced air traffic control to suspend operations, leading to the cancellation of 17 flights and disrupting travel for nearly 3,000 passengers in the German city.Another 15 arriving flights were diverted to Stuttgart, Nuremberg, Vienna and Frankfurt, the airport said in a statement, marking the latest drone disruption to European aviation after sightings temporarily shut airports in Denmark and Norway last week. Continue reading...

items.title: Munich airport reopens after drone sightings disrupt flights
items.standfirst: Germany's Munich airport reopened on Friday after several drone sightings on Thursday evening forced air traffic control to suspend operations, leading to the cancellation of 17 flights and disrupting travel for nearly 3,000 passengers. The disruption in Munich is the latest in a string of similar drone incidents in Europe.
items.content: Germany's Munich airport reopened on Friday after several drone sightings on Thursday evening forced air traffic control to suspend operations, leading to the cancellation of 17 flights and disrupting travel for nearly 3,000 passengers. The disruption in Munich is the latest in a string of similar drone incidents in Europe.

ai_summary: Munich Airport reopened after drone sightings forced air traffic to suspend operations on Thursday evening.
Seventeen flights were canceled, and nearly 3,000 passengers experienced travel disruptions due to the drone activity.
Fifteen arriving flights were diverted to other airports, including Stuttgart and Nuremberg.
The disruption is the latest in a series of drone incidents affecting European aviation.
Similar drone sightings temporarily shut down airports in Denmark and Norway last week.

clusters.title: Israel dismantles Gaza humanitarian flotilla – but one boat sails on
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel Stops Gaza Aid Flotilla, One Boat Sails On

items.title: Israel dismantles Gaza humanitarian flotilla – but one boat sails on
items.standfirst: The Israeli navy has intercepted all but one ship that formed the 44-strong Global Sumud Flotilla – the Marinette.
items.content: The Israeli navy has intercepted all but one ship that formed the 44-strong Global Sumud Flotilla – the Marinette.

items.title: Last flotilla boat sails on towards Gaza after Israeli navy interception
items.standfirst: The Global Sumud Flotilla said on Friday that 42 vessels had been "illegally intercepted" and their passengers "unlawfully abducted" by the Israeli navy, leaving only one ship, the Marinette, pressing ahead with its mission to break the Israeli blockade of Gaza.
items.content: The Global Sumud Flotilla said on Friday that 42 vessels had been "illegally intercepted" and their passengers "unlawfully abducted" by the Israeli navy, leaving only one ship, the Marinette, pressing ahead with its mission to break the Israeli blockade of Gaza.

items.title: Israel stops 41 boats in aid flotilla with one ‘still sailing strong’
items.standfirst: Activists from Global Sumud flotilla including Greta Thunberg arrested as final boat is presumed intercepted in Palestinian watersIsrael says it has stopped a pro-Palestinian flotilla carrying aid from reaching Gaza, with its navy intercepting all but one of the vessels trying to breach the blockade.Of the 42 vessels being tracked online by the Global Sumud flotilla (GSF), 41 were listed as having been confirmed or assumed to have been stopped by Israeli forces. Continue reading...
items.content: Activists from Global Sumud flotilla including Greta Thunberg arrested as final boat is presumed intercepted in Palestinian watersIsrael says it has stopped a pro-Palestinian flotilla carrying aid from reaching Gaza, with its navy intercepting all but one of the vessels trying to breach the blockade.Of the 42 vessels being tracked online by the Global Sumud flotilla (GSF), 41 were listed as having been confirmed or assumed to have been stopped by Israeli forces. Continue reading...

items.title: Israel intercepts Gaza flotilla and detains activists including Greta Thunberg
items.standfirst: South Africa and Turkey have criticised the incident in international waters. Israel says those on board are safe.
items.content: South Africa and Turkey have criticised the incident in international waters. Israel says those on board are safe.

items.title: Global Sumud Flotilla: Latest bid to break Gaza blockade drew activists from across the world
items.standfirst: The Global Sumud Flotilla, the latest humanitarian mission to try to breach Israel’s maritime blockade of Gaza, drew around 500 participants, including Greta Thunberg, from nearly 50 countries. Israeli forces began intercepted the mission in international waters on Wednesday evening.
items.content: The Global Sumud Flotilla, the latest humanitarian mission to try to breach Israel’s maritime blockade of Gaza, drew around 500 participants, including Greta Thunberg, from nearly 50 countries. Israeli forces began intercepted the mission in international waters on Wednesday evening.

items.title: Israeli navy intercepts several boats from Gaza aid flotilla
items.standfirst: Israeli naval forces on Wednesday night intercepted the Global Sumud Flotilla attempting to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza in a bid to break the Israeli blockade, according to activists. The flotilla with Greta Thunberg and several European lawmakers aboard managed to continue its journey early Thursday morning despite the interruption. Daniel Quinlan reports.
items.content: Israeli naval forces on Wednesday night intercepted the Global Sumud Flotilla attempting to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza in a bid to break the Israeli blockade, according to activists. The flotilla with Greta Thunberg and several European lawmakers aboard managed to continue its journey early Thursday morning despite the interruption. Daniel Quinlan reports.

items.title: Israel detains Greta Thunberg and others after intercepting an aid flotilla bound for Gaza
items.standfirst: Israeli forces have intercepted an aid flotilla bound for Gaza that was being closely watched around the world, boarding boats and detaining activists including Greta Thunberg who were seeking to break the blockade of the Palestinian enclave.
items.content: Israeli forces have intercepted an aid flotilla bound for Gaza that was being closely watched around the world, boarding boats and detaining activists including Greta Thunberg who were seeking to break the blockade of the Palestinian enclave.

items.title: Greta Thunberg removed from Gaza aid flotilla after 'attack' by Israel in international waters
items.standfirst: Several boats from a large aid flotilla trying to reach Gaza have been boarded by Israeli authorities - with campaigner Greta Thunberg among those removed.
items.content: Several boats from a large aid flotilla trying to reach Gaza have been boarded by Israeli authorities - with campaigner Greta Thunberg among those removed.

ai_summary: The Israeli navy intercepted all but one ship of the Global Sumud Flotilla.
The flotilla aimed to break the Israeli blockade of Gaza with humanitarian aid.
Activists from the flotilla, including Greta Thunberg, were arrested by Israeli forces.
Forty-one vessels were confirmed or assumed stopped by Israeli forces.
South Africa and Turkey criticized the incident in international waters.

items.title: Japan days away from running out of Asahi Super Dry due to cyber attack – reports
items.standfirst: The attack forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing its signature beerThe Asahi group, Japan’s biggest brewery, is reportedly just days away from running out of its most popular beer, as it struggles to recover from a cyber-attack that caused a system outage.The ransomware attack, reported on Monday, forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing it signature mass-market lager Asahi Super Dry. Continue reading...

items.title: Taylor Swift enters new era with 12th album ‘The Life of a Showgirl’
items.standfirst: Taylor Swift released her 12th studio album, "The Life of a Showgirl", on Friday, marking a return to glittering pop. The 35-year-old teamed up again with Swedish producers Max Martin and Shellback, whose signature beats and hooks drive the hotly anticipated record of love, success and revenge.

The 35-year-old teamed up again with Swedish producers Max Martin and Shellback, whose signature beats and hooks drive the hotly anticipated record of love, success and revenge.

ai_summary: Taylor Swift released her 12th studio album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on Friday.
The album marks a return to pop music, co-produced with Max Martin and Shellback.
All twelve tracks were co-written and co-produced by Swift.
The album is a return to the type of pop that made her a global star.
The album was released at midnight Friday.

clusters.title: Captain of oil tanker linked to Russia’s ‘shadow fleet’ to face trial in France
clusters.neutral_headline: Captain of oil tanker linked to Russia’s ‘shadow fleet’ to face trial in France

items.title: Captain of oil tanker linked to Russia’s ‘shadow fleet’ to face trial in France
items.standfirst: Vladimir Putin denounces seizing of the vessel as an act of piracy and warned it could provoke confrontationThe captain of an oil tanker that authorities in France have detained off the country’s Atlantic coast and that President Emmanuel Macron has linked to Russia will go on trial in February over the crew’s alleged refusal to cooperate, a French prosecutor has said.Macron has alleged that the tanker belongs to Russia’s “shadow fleet” of ageing tankers of uncertain ownership that are avoiding western sanctions over Moscow’s war in Ukraine. He also did not rule out that it could have been involved in drone flights over Denmark as it was sailing last week off the coast of the Nordic country. Continue reading...
items.content: Vladimir Putin denounces seizing of the vessel as an act of piracy and warned it could provoke confrontationThe captain of an oil tanker that authorities in France have detained off the country’s Atlantic coast and that President Emmanuel Macron has linked to Russia will go on trial in February over the crew’s alleged refusal to cooperate, a French prosecutor has said.Macron has alleged that the tanker belongs to Russia’s “shadow fleet” of ageing tankers of uncertain ownership that are avoiding western sanctions over Moscow’s war in Ukraine. He also did not rule out that it could have been involved in drone flights over Denmark as it was sailing last week off the coast of the Nordic country. Continue reading...

items.title: Putin calls detention of Russia-linked tanker by France 'piracy'
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday slammed the detention of a Russia-linked oil tanker by France as "piracy". French President Emmanuel Macron called on Europe Thursday to take coordinated action against Russia's so-called shadow fleet, and follow his country's lead in detaining vessels used to bust western sanctions and fuel Moscow's war in Ukraine. FRANCE 24's Eliza Herbert reports.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday slammed the detention of a Russia-linked oil tanker by France as "piracy". French President Emmanuel Macron called on Europe Thursday to take coordinated action against Russia's so-called shadow fleet, and follow his country's lead in detaining vessels used to bust western sanctions and fuel Moscow's war in Ukraine. FRANCE 24's Eliza Herbert reports.

ai_summary: The captain of a Russia-linked oil tanker detained by France will go on trial in February.
French President Macron linked the tanker to Russia's "shadow fleet."
The captain is accused of refusing to cooperate with authorities.
Putin called the detention of the tanker "piracy."
Macron called for coordinated action against Russia's shadow fleet.

items.title: Treasure hunters discover $1m in silver and gold coins off Florida coast
items.standfirst: Valuables were being transported in 1715 from American colonies when a hurricane wrecked a Spanish fleetHidden beneath the turquoise waters off a stretch of Florida known as the “treasure coast”, a team of divers from a shipwreck salvage company have uncovered exactly that – a load of long-lost Spanish treasure they estimate is worth $1m.More than 1,000 silver and gold coins thought to be minted in the Spanish colonies where Bolivia, Mexico and Peru now sit were uncovered this summer off Florida’s Atlantic coast, 1715 Fleet-Queens Jewels LLC announced this week. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

clusters.title: OpenAI’s Sora 2 lets users insert themselves into AI videos with sound
clusters.neutral_headline: OpenAI’s Sora 2 lets users insert themselves into AI videos with sound

items.title: OpenAI’s Sora 2 lets users insert themselves into AI videos with sound
items.standfirst: Sora social app launches with deepfake-style "cameos" and feed controls.
items.content: On Tuesday, OpenAI announced Sora 2, its second-generation video-synthesis AI model that can now generate videos in various styles with synchronized dialogue and sound effects, which is a first for the company. OpenAI also launched a new iOS social app that allows users to insert themselves into AI-generated videos through what OpenAI calls "cameos." OpenAI showcased the new model in an AI-generated video that features a photorealistic version of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman talking to the camera in a slightly unnatural-sounding voice amid fantastical backdrops, like a competitive ride-on duck race and a glowing mushroom garden. Regarding that voice, the new model can create what OpenAI calls "sophisticated background soundscapes, speech, and sound effects with a high degree of realism." In May, Google's Veo 3 became the first video-synthesis model from a major AI lab to generate synchronized audio as well as video. Just a few days ago, Alibaba released Wan 2.5, an open-weights video model that can generate audio as well. Now OpenAI has joined the audio party with Sora 2.Read full article Comments

items.title: OpenAI’s New Sora App Lets You Deepfake Yourself for Entertainment
